reviewText:
Co-op romp'n'stomp with maximal action and lots of disgusting tentacles.

----

+ Fantastic co-op action experience
+ Plenty of unlocks and additional content
+ Graphics are excellent
+ Ammo management is a real concern from start to finish
+ Excellent gamepad support

+/- Story is garbage, but the changing environments keep it ticking along nicely.
+/- Keyboard and Mouse controls didn't feel anywhere near as good as gamepad, but YMMV.
+/- Partner AI is basic but does work if you have no friends.

- No local co-op
- A tad repetitive

----

Resident Evil 5 is markedly different from all the previous games in the series in that the focus on the horror aspect is almost completely diminished. The creepy atmospheric terror of the past games is gone, but there is a different kind of violent apprehension present in this game which gives you the feeling that you definitely want to avoid dying if you can help it. Aint nobody want whatever the hell that monster is up in your junk!

I first played Resident Evil 5 many years ago now in a friend's house, sitting next to him on local co-op and the experience was fantastic. So it is a bit perturbing that the PC port has the local co-op stripped out, but online co-op seems to function fine.

Overall, if you are after a convincing horror game then you may want to look elsewhere but if high quality action is your thing then buying this is never going to be a bad choice. If you've got a buddy to play with then you're both in for a great time.

reviewText:
Took a little bit of getting used to this title.  The control scheme is awkward (strafe keys become turn keys while running, can't shoot and move, can't shoot with aiming etc) which is a bit of a theme in the earlier resident evil games. On my rig I had frequent graphical glitches which an alt-tab resolved, other than that it looks good enough.

Worth perserving with, though not exactly a scary game, more of a 3rd person shooter with zombies.

reviewText:
First half is decent if only because it basically emulates Resident Evil 4 but with a bit more racism. The AI partner isn't very bright so you might want to play it coop.

Then you get to the second half of the game when the zombies have guns and the game forces you to use poorly implemented cover shooting mechanics and everything goes downhill. The game becomes really not fun to play and a lot of the bosses are really poorly designed. At least half of them don't make it clear what you have to do, or if what you are doing is having any effect.

The mercenary mode you unlock by finishing the campaign is fantastic and really fun though and is pretty much the only reason I give this game a recommendation.

Oh yeah, the game uses GFWL for co-op. Not only that service is garbage but it will be taken down in July 2014. So on second though, don't buy this. Get a console version if you can.

This game gave me cancer. I hate it. I hate it so badly that I am going to choke a baby wulrus. And then I am going to ♥♥♥♥ on its corpse after spraying it with an AK-47 and making it mother watch.


This game started out fun. I played it with a close friend and it was fun for the first few chapters. After that, it went WAY down in fun after the insta-kill enemies showed up, then more so after the bullet-sponge lickers. And I actually developed a headache at the fully-armored zombies. We stopped on the 12th chapter after bearing the rest and finally decided we were done torturing ourselves with it.

For your sanity, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

reviewText: Easily the worst entry in the Resident Evil franchise. Don't get me wrong it's a fun game; if you have a co-op partner. But if you want it as a single player experience, be prepared to suffer with the worst friendly AI of all time who will literally do nothing but waste any ammo you provide her. Do NOT play Resident Evil 5 unless you have a friend to play with.

reviewText: Even though it has little in common with its predecessors (basically just an action game, no puzzles/horror like the originals), I still think this is the most fun game in the series.  Solid gameplay, good replayability (I've probably been through it 10+ times), and the coop mode is awesome.  In addition, the storyline in this game tries to tie things in from previous games and I think it's actually quite good and interesting for a Resident Evil game.

reviewText: Another amazing product by Capcom. Been a fan of the Resident Evil/Biohazard series since the 90s. It sticks to its survival horror roots but offers some good intense shooter elements in the mix. Highly recommend this game whether you're a fan or not.

reviewText:
I would recommend this game 100%, if it weren't for the little issue, and by little, is kind of big, but only because I enjoy playing with other people.

If you want to play this game alone however, this is a great experience.

If you want to play with randoms online in either the base game or the DLC it will be next to impossible to find anyone ever hosting a game in the DLC (which is why all DLC-related achievements are locked for me, otherwise I have 100%'ed this game twice now - on PC and I was able to get all achievements including DLC on console), and on top of that, voice chat does not work currently.
If you're lucky, and on at the right time, you may find people playing the base game.
It's just a huge shame that no one plays the DLC, it was my favorite part of the game, back on PS3.
